channel.title: Language Translator v.1
channel.description:
[center][size=14pt][b]Language Translator v.1[/b][/size] by Ron[/center]
Screenshot: [img]http://img176.imageshack.us/img176/8269/languagetranslatorv1byrmc4.png[/img]
Hope you like it! This is based off of Kaitnieks' testhttp2.scar under the Test folder.
~Ron :)

item.title: Language Translator v.1
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:33, topic:54444”][quote author=XxKanexX link=topic=76883.msg1248053#msg1248053 date=1178019621]
I don’t think there is a function that saves to the clipboard, so no, you can’t.
[/quote]

Yeah there is. I’ve used it in a number of my scripts. Here is some test code for it. 

program ClipboardTestByRon;

var
  Form1 : TForm;
  Memo1 : TMemo;

procedure CopyToClip(Sender : TObject);
begin
  Memo1.SelectAll;
  Memo1.CopyToClipboard;
end;

procedure PasteFromClip(Sender : TObject);
begin
  Memo1.PasteFromClipboard;
end;

procedure InitForm;
var
  Button1, Button2 : TButton;
begin
  Form1 := CreateForm;
  Form1.Caption := 'Clipboard Test by Ron';
  Form1.Position := poScreenCenter;
  Form1.BorderIcons := [biSystemMenu, biMinimize];
  Form1.BorderStyle := bsSingle;
  Memo1 := TMemo.Create(Form1);
  Memo1.Parent := Form1;
  Memo1.Top := 10;
  Memo1.Left := 10;
  Memo1.Width := Form1.ClientWidth - (Memo1.Left * 2);
  Memo1.Height := Form1.ClientHeight - 55;
  Button1 := TButton.Create(Form1);
  Button1.Parent := Form1;
  Button1.Caption := 'Copy To Clip';
  Button1.Width := 100;
  Button1.Top := Memo1.Height + Memo1.Top + 10;
  Button1.Left := 10;
  Button1.OnClick := @CopyToClip;
  Button2 := TButton.Create(Form1);
  Button2.Parent := Form1;
  Button2.Caption := 'Paste From Clip';
  Button2.Width := Button1.Width;
  Button2.Top := Button1.Top;
  Button2.Left := Form1.ClientWidth - Button2.Width - Button1.Left;
  Button2.OnClick := @PasteFromClip;
end;

procedure SafeInitForm;
var
  v : TVariantArray;
begin
  SetArrayLength(v, 0);
  ThreadSafeCall('InitForm', v);
end;

procedure ShowFormDesign;
begin
  Form1.ShowModal;
end;

procedure SafeShowFormDesign;
var
  v : TVariantArray;
begin
  SetArrayLength(v, 0);
  ThreadSafeCall('ShowFormDesign', v);
end;

procedure MainInitForm;
begin
  try
    SafeInitForm;
    SafeShowFormDesign;
  finally
    FreeForm(Form1);
  except
    WriteLn('An error seems to have occurred in: InitForm');
  end;
end;

begin
  ClearDebug;
  MainInitForm;
end.

Also, thanks for all the great comments. I appreciate them very much.

~Ron :)[/quote]
Wow, interesting.

You know to much.

Read full topic

item.title: Language Translator v.1
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

XxKanexX:

I don’t think there is a function that saves to the clipboard, so no, you can’t.

Yeah there is. I’ve used it in a number of my scripts. Here is some test code for it. 

program ClipboardTestByRon;

var
  Form1 : TForm;
  Memo1 : TMemo;

procedure CopyToClip(Sender : TObject);
begin
  Memo1.SelectAll;
  Memo1.CopyToClipboard;
end;

procedure PasteFromClip(Sender : TObject);
begin
  Memo1.PasteFromClipboard;
end;

procedure InitForm;
var
  Button1, Button2 : TButton;
begin
  Form1 := CreateForm;
  Form1.Caption := 'Clipboard Test by Ron';
  Form1.Position := poScreenCenter;
  Form1.BorderIcons := [biSystemMenu, biMinimize];
  Form1.BorderStyle := bsSingle;
  Memo1 := TMemo.Create(Form1);
  Memo1.Parent := Form1;
  Memo1.Top := 10;
  Memo1.Left := 10;
  Memo1.Width := Form1.ClientWidth - (Memo1.Left * 2);
  Memo1.Height := Form1.ClientHeight - 55;
  Button1 := TButton.Create(Form1);
  Button1.Parent := Form1;
  Button1.Caption := 'Copy To Clip';
  Button1.Width := 100;
  Button1.Top := Memo1.Height + Memo1.Top + 10;
  Button1.Left := 10;
  Button1.OnClick := @CopyToClip;
  Button2 := TButton.Create(Form1);
  Button2.Parent := Form1;
  Button2.Caption := 'Paste From Clip';
  Button2.Width := Button1.Width;
  Button2.Top := Button1.Top;
  Button2.Left := Form1.ClientWidth - Button2.Width - Button1.Left;
  Button2.OnClick := @PasteFromClip;
end;

procedure SafeInitForm;
var
  v : TVariantArray;
begin
  SetArrayLength(v, 0);
  ThreadSafeCall('InitForm', v);
end;

procedure ShowFormDesign;
begin
  Form1.ShowModal;
end;

procedure SafeShowFormDesign;
var
  v : TVariantArray;
begin
  SetArrayLength(v, 0);
  ThreadSafeCall('ShowFormDesign', v);
end;

procedure MainInitForm;
begin
  try
    SafeInitForm;
    SafeShowFormDesign;
  finally
    FreeForm(Form1);
  except
    WriteLn('An error seems to have occurred in: InitForm');
  end;
end;

begin
  ClearDebug;
  MainInitForm;
end.

Also, thanks for all the great comments. I appreciate them very much.

~Ron

Read full topic

item.title: Language Translator v.1
item.dc:creator: @junkj junkj
item.description:
@junkj wrote:

Ron:

Unbiased opinion: I wouldn’t really call that disgusting. I have no problem talking about sexual organs. Just another human part of the body. I mean if dick grosses you out, do tits gross you out as well? Might as well not have a double standard, eh?

1-Im not gay

2-im straight, i dont like men dicks. (X.X)

3-since im straight, tits dont gross me out.Nothing in the girls body organ thing grosses me out.

Read full topic

item.title: Language Translator v.1
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Unbiased opinion: I wouldn’t really call that disgusting. I have no problem talking about sexual organs. Just another human part of the body. I mean if dick grosses you out, do tits gross you out as well? Might as well not have a double standard, eh?

Glad you guys like the script! And I found a way to make it print with the accents besides using replace statements, but it won’t appear in the Memo2 box. Instead it will appear in the debug box.

Read full topic
